description.narrative: The World Food Programme (WFP) led a joint UN Rapid Assessment to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) in March 2011, visiting 35 of 209 counties and collecting data from schools, hospitals, orphanages, farmers' markets, grain distribution centres and households. Following the mission, the UN assesses that up to six million people will face severe food shortages, with the most vulnerable being pregnant women, nursing women, children and the elderly. Under this initiative, AusAID will provide funding to WFP and UNICEF for humanitarian aid in DPRK to save lives, alleviate suffering and maintain human dignity during and in the aftermath of conflict and humanitarian crisis by specifically to: supply micro nutrients to nursing mothers and acutely malnourished children; and improve access for children in institutions to clean water, sanitation and hygiene. The total value of this initiative is $3.5 million during the 2011-12 financial year.
